title: Who Killed Garrett Phillips? is so disturbing viewers' stomachs are 'churning'
text:
The witch hunt against Nick Hillary in Who Killed Garrett Phillips is ‘stomach churning’ (Picture: Sky Crime)

Who Killed Garrett Phillips? has been described as among the most disturbing true crime documentaries ever, following the unsolved murder of a 12-year-old boy in 2011 and the incompetent hunt for his killer.

The two-part film which launched on Sky Crime this weekend exposes the racism of Potsdam, a town dead set on sending down one of its few non-white residents, Nick Hillary, without any physical evidence linking him to the death. Nick’s only connection to Garrett was a 12 month relationship with the child’s mother Tandy Cyrus, which became the sole justification for a police investigation that would eventually go on for a further five years.

During Who Killed Garrett Phillips? unimaginable horrors unfold as Nick is duped into speaking to police unaware that he’s a suspect, before he’s forced to strip naked and be photographed for a full body examination.

An entire town were dead set on sending an innocent man down (Picture: Sky Crime)

Then came the witch hunt as ‘Justice For Garrett’ posters were drawn up on every street corner, but basically read as ‘Send Nick Hillary down’.

And the documentary doesn’t shy away from suggesting why.

‘Postdam isn’t racist, there’s just not many African-Americans here,’ notes one resident, overlooking Nick’s Jamaican heritage.

Tanya’s other ex-partner John Jones – an officer who also worked on the case and comes under suspicion in the documentary – faced an alarmingly tamer interrogation, where his ‘strip search’ involved rolling up his jumper sleeves. His face was also kept out of all photographs rendering the evidence useless.

The difference in both examinations says it all.

In turn, while fighting for his freedom, Nick also lost his job, his reputation couldn’t have been beaten any more and while he was eventually found not guilty of Garrett’s murder, he will inevitably face as much of a life sentence, albeit without the bars.

Viewers haven’t just been appalled by the findings in Who Killed Garrett Phillips? they’ve called the film ‘stomach churning’ and ‘the most uncomfortable watch’.

Nick’s life has been ruined by the accusations, but Garrett’s killer was never found and his family are still no closer to the closure they’ve been searching for since his death eight years ago.

Police have now revealed that, finally, they are investigating new leads.

Who Killed Garrett Phillips? airs on Sky Crime and is available to stream on NOW TV.
